text:
330mL bottle from Slowbeer
Pale straw body, clear body, white foam.
Moderate nose to it - get a distinct grainy malt character with fragrant floral & citrusy hops.
Medium-light body, drying texture but clean overall.
Grainy, husk, cereal sort of malt - provides a dryness of its own early on - leads into moderate fruity hops & florals, and a restrained bitterness.
Really nice overall - a lager that would compete with most golden & some pale ales.

Draft at Taps, Changkat. Clear golden with a white head. Aroma of grain, light fruity hops, herbal hops, citrus and light malt. Flavour is above light sweet and light to moderate bitter. Light bodied with light carbonation.
330ml bottle into glass. Sweet malt nose. Pale amber with thin film on top. Slight zing, fruity taste. Sweet finish. Superior Asian style lager. Super easy drinking, whole glass gone in an instant.

Draft at Taps Beer Bar, Kuala Lumpur. Poured a hazy straw colour with a frothy white head and a little broken lace. The aroma is citrus yeast. The flavour is herbal veggie, very light sour with a citrus light acid light mineral palate. Light bodied with average carbonation.
On tap at the public brewery nice citrus aroma pale straw in colour with small white head taste is very refreshing with citrus finish

An interesting entry by 2 Brothers that doesn't quite engage the taste buds to the extent that you would expect a Rice Beer to. A slightly shark aroma is contrasted by a smooth palate that doesn't quite reach the peaks you expect. Worth a taste but not upper echelon.

Frangimus

UPDATED: AUG 2, 2014 Tasting at Plonk, re rating with a bottle. This pale amber coloured rice lager has some toffee sweetness and packs a surprising burst of hoppy flavour with little bitterness. Great summer session beer, very ?smashable?. Could drink one after the other in the sun very happily.

This beer surprised me. I am not usually a fan of rice lagers, however this has some nice complexity. Pale straw yellow with a white head. High carbonation. Very fruit arms of citrus, straw and pineapple. Nice malty flavour, unexpected because of the rice.
It pours a bright clear yellow, fast diminishing head, fruity lemon aroma, unbelievably refreshing to drink, could easily drink several.
Tap. Clear, golden, frothy, light sweetness, lightly bitter, light body, thin feel, lively, & abrupt finish.

Very nice passion fruit aroma. Clear golden colour with great head. Very very nice passion fruit and rockmelon flavours. Light to med body with med carbonation 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottle at Mrs Parmas. Pours a pale golden color with a fairly small head that fades to bits of lacing. Aroma is fruity, with citrus, bit of malt sweetness and grassy. Taste of citrus, fruit, mild malt sweetness and bit of gain. Mild bitterness and a clean finish. Light body, Crisp, fresh and refreshing. Nice beer that hits the sport on a hot summer day.

Surprisingly good. First time I tried it didn't enjoy, but second tasting was good. Lovely foamy head settles well. Nice high aroma, great rounded taste with ok palate / aftertaste. Where's the rice? Nice enough drop. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

from a 330ml bottle on 29/8/2013. Pours a clear medium yellow with a small head. Has quite a nice light fruity aroma featuring lychee, pineapple and passionfruit. The flavour is more subdued in comparison, with some sweet fruity notes, a bit of rice and some light bready malt. The body is light and carbonation moderate. Easy to drink and very interesting for a pale lager.

Draught at Mrs Parmas, Melbourne. On July 25, 2013.Marked 4.6% ABV.Clear pear to pale straw yellow color, white head. Fruity, hoppy, citrus taste, fresh. Medium mouthfeel, medium bitterness. Sweet, hoppy scent. Fruity, citrus aftertaste.

Ripper of a lager! Packed full of hoppy flavor. Very refreshing on tap. One of my favorite lagers.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

On tap at Mrs Parmas. Pours a vibrant orange with a small white head. Aroma is very hoppy - lots of citrus and grapefruit, followed closely by bits of rice and pine. Smells amazing. Hops are very upfront to start with which holds nicely whilst the rice notes linger at the backend. Super easy drinking and goes down wonderfully on tap

330ml bottle. Very clear in the glass with a golden amber colour and a soft white head. Surprised by the passionfruit in the aroma as I was expecting more skunky aromas. Light flavour and light in he mouth, a good session beer.

Mrs. Parmas, light simple citrus lemonade aroma.  Clear yellow colour and ordinar head. Slight sour citrus, light stale herbal hop flavour. Spritzig mouthfeel and tangy bitter stale finish and herbal hop aftertaste.

Large frothy head gold pour medium strong carbonation aromas fruity esters grain malt caramel bread the flavours light fruit bread yeast grain not much bitter sweet caramel lemon the finish a smooth tasting ale best aftertastes grain sweetness malt good for its type
Light and tangy. Great summer beer. Appearance is light and clear. Tastes of lime/ citrus. Very drinkable.

UPDATED: JUN 16, 2012 330ml bottle. 2 fingers pure white head. Frothy head, almost like beaten egg white, but with some larger bubbles. Fades quickly to a cap. Colour is a clear light golden, almost like apple juice. Nice orange, floral and slightly peachy hop nose, with just a hint of a grainy, musty, dusty note which may be from the rice. Straight up, loads of peach and sweetness on the attack. Also, some refreshing orange and lime citrus flavours. Peach flavours for days. A slight bit of hop bitterness on the finish, with a tiny jab of herbaceousness and some citrus. Leaves a pleasant lagery taste in the mouth, which fades quickly. As the beer warms you get more of a rice flavour on the finish, which is quite pleasant. Very crisp and clean. Mouth feel is very soft. I really mean that. Almost like having a pillow in your mouth. Carbonation is fine. Good basic beer. Not overly complex, but refreshing, well rounded and well made.
Tried this at AIBA dinner. Wasnt expecting a lot from this rice lager but a good dose of hops come through in the taste .

Pours pale yellow with a large, quickly fading head.
Nose shows grassy hops, soft fruit (lychee, pear?). Very little else.
Flavours include the same light fruit along with some very soft sweet malt. Those hops a damn nice.
Carbonation is very high but needs to be really, considering how sweet this is.
Apart from that this was pretty good stuff, could be quite dangerous of a hot afternoon!

It is unusual to normally enjoy a beer of this style. Nice apricot aroma and pour is very light amber, crystal clear and thin white head. Flavor is initial apricot that moves to a very faint bittering finish and like a ninja it is gone.

On tap at 3 degrees. Better-than-average pale lager. Aromas of hay, citrus, and wet leaves. Taste is sweet, with light bitterness, and short length. Palate is oily, and medium bodied. Yellow, with a frothy head.

Bottle from Mane Liquor. Pours bright orange with a small white head which quickly disappears. Lacing clings to the glass nicely. Aroma is very vibrant hops - lots of citrus, zest and grapefruit, followed closely by rice and pine. Very nice nose. Vibrant citric hoppage to begin with which doesnt entirely die down while the rice note takes control. Finishes like Ive just swallowed a sushi roll. Spritzy carbonation but flows nicely. Really well made beer and something unique. I like it a lot
